steps.raw_llm_response:

1. I'm on the checkout page, ready to finalize a purchase. I always double-check details before spending money, especially on something like a TV.
2. I see my payment method is pre-selected as my VISA, which is good. I'd need to enter the security code, but I want to review the rest of the order first.
3. I glance at the "Order Summary" on the right. Store pickup location looks correct and convenient.
4. I see the Insignia TV listed. The price seems like a good deal, which appeals to my value-conscious nature.
5. My attention is drawn to the "Digital Delivery" section. It lists "jimmymcart@yahoo.com". That's not my email address! This is concerning. Any digital services or important notifications related to the TV would go to the wrong person.
6. I can't directly edit the email from this screen. To ensure the correct email address is associated with my purchase, I need to go back to a previous step where I can review or modify delivery options.
7. The "Back to Pickup & Delivery Options" link is the most logical place to go to verify or change the digital delivery information before I commit to the purchase. I won't proceed with someone else's email on my order.
